summary:
The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions, adopted resolution 1694 (2006) on 13 July 2006, deciding to adjust the configuration of the United Nations Mission in Liberia (UNMIL) as recommended by the Secretary-General. The Council noted the completion of tasks by UNMIL and reviewed its mandates and composition. 

Determining the situation in Liberia remains a threat to international peace and security, the Council, acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter, decided to: 

- Increase UNMIL's civilian police component by 125; 
- Decrease UNMIL's military component by 125. 

The Council decided to remain actively seized of the matter.
